Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Restrict package sources" (#8355) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Restrict package sources to those explicitly listed in the `nuget.config` file. This prevents build issues where packages may come from unexpected package sources due to other `nuget.config` files (see [this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/configuring-nuget-behavior#config-file-locations-and-uses)).

Part of https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3525

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][WCAG2.1][Reflow]Dropdown information is cut off when zoomed in." (#8285) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188115

# Environment Details:
#URL:Application URL for NuGet Service
Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

# OS Details
Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 



# Note: 
Under 'Members' Administrator dropdown is not visible clearly after applying reflow
# Repro Steps:
Change the Display resolution to 1280*1024 in System display settings
Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
Tab till "Manage organizations" and Press enter
Tab till "Edit " present in any record the table and press enter
Tab till Certificates and expand it 
Apply reflow and Check whether data is missing or not  
### Actual Results:

Some of the data is missing when reflow is applied under the Certificates
### Expected Results:
User should be able to view the data without missing and all the information should be visible clearly with one scrollbar after applying reflow
### User Impact:
Users will not be able to see the information if it gets overlapped in reflow

# Notes:
We will probably want to update the layout to move the dropdown to the next line when the horizontal width is below a certain amount.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add vulnerabilities service" (#8357) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Starts to address: https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7650.

PR https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8356 must be merged before this one.

Here I introduce the new package vulnerability service. This service's job is simple at this point--return a dictionary of package keys with a list of vulnerabilities for each. Some plumbing is also added to make those values available to view models.

There is also the renaming of an EF navigation property Vulnerabilities to VulnerablePackageRanges, which is more representative.

Again, a few files here, but there's quite a bit of repetition for the rename and plumbing.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Rename vulnerability management service, add feature flag" (#8356) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Starts to address: https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7650

This is a rename of the existing vulnerability service to a vulnerability management service, and the vulnerability service verifier to a vulnerability verifier. Quite a few files in this PR, but it's very repetitive.

Also, I've introduced a feature flag here for use in vulnerability messaging.

This is all groundwork for the PRs to follow.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Introduce a new msbuild property to exclude build output for specific tfms during pack task" (#10396) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Nuget currently provides a msbuild called IncludeBuildOutput to disable including the build output for all tfms. 
Nuget provides this kind of feature for other targets like ```_GetFrameworksWithSuppressedDependencies``` which run during the pack command.
It will enable the scenario where developer wants to exclude a certain kind of build output for a specific tfm.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Make NuspecReader async" (#10395) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: [NuGet.Packaging](https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Packaging/5.8.0) package
NuGet version: 5.8.0
Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. `NuspecReader` class [constructor](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/b5b44526dea0379ebd6c8e51e8a041c06d5845ca/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Core/NuspecCoreReaderBase.cs#L61) that accepts `Stream` reads from it [synchronously](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/b5b44526dea0379ebd6c8e51e8a041c06d5845ca/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Core/NuspecCoreReaderBase.cs#L222) inside said constructor.
2. Try using it in an environment when the `Stream` passed into the constructor is actually reading from the network, have it happen when there are network issues and you might be blocking the thread for seconds. Which may in turn lead to thread starvation if used carelessly in say a web service.

(I don't have any real user/service impacting repro at this point though).

There are definitely workarounds (one I can imagine is that the service would read the nuspec stream contents asynchronously, put it into the `MemoryStream` and pass that into the `NuspecReader` constructor), but it could be streamlined.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Overhaul Pack/Push documentation to prioritize modern package authoring" (#10394) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Reading through [our documentation on package authoring](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/create-packages/overview-and-workflow) is pretty confusing these days, because it's largely written with `packages.config` and `.nuspec` scenarios in mind. I've also noticed that a lot of documentation related to doing certain tasks in SDK-style projects is just plain missing.

We should comb through the docs and overhaul them to represent the way we do things _now_, while deprioritizing (but still documenting) the `.nuspec`/non-SDK scenarios.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to view which unit test fails?" (#10387) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I clone fresh repository and run full build. It produce following error

```
error : Desktop CoreUnitTests tests failed! Results: d:\NuGet.Client\build\TestResults\CoreUnitTests-xunit.xml
```

Steps which I perform. 
1. git clone
2. .\configure.ps1
3. .\build.ps1

I definitely can open XML file and find where tests fails, but how I can do that in more pleasant way?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Static graph restore spams unnnecessary messages about MSBuildStartupDirectory" (#10335) at NuGet/Home
Reopened issue "How to run specific unit test?" (#10388) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have file with failed unit tests, I found list of failed unit tests by running `Select-String -Pattern Result .\build\TestResults\CoreUnitTests-xunit.xml | Select-String -NotMatch -Pattern Pass | Select-String -NotMatch -Pattern Skip`

What's the way how to run single unit test?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Log content hash when installing packages on restore" (#10384) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: During restore, when a package is downloaded/installed, log the content hash so it appears in a CI log.

Closed issue "System.InvalidOperationException: The operation failed as details for project foo.App could not be loaded when trying to update nuget packages" (#10371) at NuGet/Home

## Details about Problem

VS version (if appropriate): VS16.9.0 Preview 2.0

OS version: Win10 1803, 17134.1902

1. open sln

2. try to update nuget references

...

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
